mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Acknowledges his letter of Oct. 10; has never wished to control right of private opinion or suffrage in officers of government; only feels it wrong when they disapprove principles of administration sanctioned by will of nation and use their offices to actively oppose them.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1806 November 3, Washington, [D.C.] to C. Parker, [Norfolk, Virginia].
